properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 7:46PM MST until January 13 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula MT
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected.
Total valley snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches with 16 to
24 inches over Lookout Pass. The highest valley accumulations
are expected near the Idaho border along Highway 200 from
Thompson Falls to Heron and along Interstate 90 from Saint
Regis to Lookout Pass. Locations further east can expect 2 to
5 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible.
Total snow accumulations of 5 to 14 inches possible.

* WHERE...Evaro Hill, Highway 200 Thompson Falls to Plains,
Highway 200 Trout Creek to Heron, and I-90 Lookout Pass to
Haugan.

* WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 3 PM MST Saturday.
For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through
Monday morning.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy
blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING
